title: How to Lose Weight from Your Face

steps.title: Set a realistic weight loss goal if you need to lose weight.
steps.content: Set a realistic weight loss goal if you need to lose weight . Losing weight in your body is the best way to promote weight loss in your face. Losing weight takes time and hard work, but even a modest weight loss can provide lasting benefits to your health. Start with a small, manageable weight loss goal to build your confidence. [1] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Aim to lose 1 to 2 pounds per week. [2] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source For example, you might set a goal for yourself to lose 6 pounds over the course of 6 weeks.

steps.title: Check your diet for foods and drinks that might cause puffiness.
steps.content: Check your diet for foods and drinks that might cause puffiness. Certain foods may contribute to bloating , which could cause your face to look puffy. Try keeping a food diary to see what foods might contribute to bloating. You may want to try an elimination diet . For instance, these foods may contribute to bloating: [3] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Carbonated beverages Wheat gluten Dairy products Cabbage Beans Broccoli Sprouts Cauliflower Onions Salty foods, such as chips, frozen pizza, and deli meats

steps.title: Exercise
steps.content: Exercise to help promote weight loss and circulation. Exercising regularly can make your face look slimmer by helping you shed excess weight. If you don't have excess weight to lose, then exercise can help promote good circulation and reduce puffiness in your face. [4] X Research source Make sure to choose a form of exercise you enjoy, such as walking , dancing, swimming, or biking. [5] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Aim to do 30 minutes or more of moderate physical activity most days of the week.

steps.title: Get more sleep
steps.content: Get more sleep to help your endocrine system work properly. A lack of sleep may predispose you to issues with your endocrine system, such as diabetes. Get between 7 and 9 hours of sleep every night to wake rested and refreshed and to promote a healthy endocrine system. This may help prevent problems that might lead to facial weight gain. [6] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Try to make your bedroom a relaxing place to promote better sleep, such as by keeping it cool, dark, clean, and quiet. You can also get better sleep by limiting or avoiding caffeine , shutting off screens at least 30 minutes before bedtime, and avoiding doing anything other than sleeping in your bed.

steps.title: Drink more water
steps.content: Drink more water to stay hydrated and reduce water retention. Staying hydrated can help reduce puffiness in your face. If you don't drink enough water, you might be holding onto it in different areas of your body, including your face. [7] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Aim for 11 to 15 c (2,600 to 3,500 mL) of water daily, but drink more if you're sweating or thirsty. [8] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Fill a water bottle before you head out in the morning and refill it throughout the day while you’re at work or school.

steps.title: Limit or abstain from alcohol.
steps.content: Limit or abstain from alcohol . Drinking alcohol may increase facial puffiness, so it's best to limit your drinks. Stick to no more than 1 alcoholic drink per day for women or 2 per day for men. One drink is equal to 12 fl oz (350 mL) of beer, 5 fl oz (150 mL) of wine, or 1.5 fl oz (44 mL) of spirits. [9] X Research source Try drinking a simple mocktail when you want to have a drink instead. Combine sparkling water, a splash of cranberry juice, and a lime wedge for an easy, tasty, low-calorie drink option. If you find it hard to quit drinking, talk with your doctor for personalized advice. [10] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Say “X” and “O” 20 times each in a row.
steps.content: Say “X” and “O” 20 times each in a row. Alternating between saying “X” and “O” works the muscles in your face. Say “X-O-X-O” out loud 20 times each and emphasize each letter for maximum benefit. [11] X Research source Try doing this exercise while getting dressed in the morning.

steps.title: Suck in your cheeks like a fish 20 times daily.
steps.content: Suck in your cheeks like a fish 20 times daily. This might look a little silly, but it will work the muscles in your cheeks. Pull your cheeks in, hold for 5 seconds, then release. Repeat this 20 times throughout the day. [12] X Research source Try doing this exercise while you style your hair or do your makeup.

steps.title: Open your mouth wide, hold for 5 seconds, and then relax.
steps.content: Open your mouth wide, hold for 5 seconds, and then relax. Open up as wide as you can so that it looks like you are screaming or yelling. Then, hold your mouth in this position to the count of 5 and release. Repeat this 30 times per day. [13] X Research source Try doing this while you are making your bed or doing another household chore.

steps.title: Swish air around in your mouth for 5 minutes per day.
steps.content: Swish air around in your mouth for 5 minutes per day. Take a deep breath in, and then close your mouth. Allow some of the air to fill up your mouth so that it looks like it is full. Then, swish the air around your mouth to exercise your facial muscles. Make sure to breathe normally as you do this. [14] X Research source Aim for a total of 5 minutes of air swishing per day. For example, you could do this for 2 minutes in the morning and 3 minutes in the afternoon, or do all 5 minutes at once if you prefer.

steps.title: Give yourself a facial massage after your workout.
steps.content: Give yourself a facial massage after your workout. Press your fingertips against your face, starting at your forehead and working downwards to your temples and cheeks. Then, press your fingertips against the sides of your nose and move them out towards your cheeks and downwards. Next, press your fingers along your jawline and towards the underside of your jaw. You can also go to a professional massage therapist or use a jade roller to massage your face. [15] X Research source The massage will help to promote better circulation and drainage of lymphatic fluid from your face. [16] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Lymphatic fluid is what builds up around your lymph nodes. If too much of it builds up, it may cause swelling in different parts of your body.

steps.title: See your doctor to check for underlying conditions.
steps.content: See your doctor to check for underlying conditions. Some medical conditions can cause you to hold onto excess weight in your face, so check with your doctor if you have noticed sudden or dramatic weight gain. For instance, they may test for Cushing's and hypothyroidism since these can cause weight gain in your face. [17] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Ask your doctor if your medications could cause facial weight gain.
steps.content: Ask your doctor if your medications could cause facial weight gain. A new or existing medication may be to blame for facial puffiness or weight gain (also known as “moon face”). Talk with your doctor if you have recently started a new medication and noticed this side effect. [18] X Research source For example, a rare reaction to oxycodone is swelling of the face and extremities. [19] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Look into a facelift if other options have not helped.
steps.content: Look into a facelift if other options have not helped. Although plastic surgery can be expensive and invasive, it might be a considerable option if other methods haven’t provided results. Ask your primary care physician for a referral or find an experienced plastic surgeon on your own. Don't go for the cheapest option. Make sure that the surgeon is well-qualified and has a lot of experience with facial surgery. [20] X Research source Meet with the surgeon to find out if you might be a good candidate for a facelift or other form of surgery to reduce the size of your face. A combination of therapies, such as liposuction and a facelift, might be recommended.
